text: Donald St. P. Richards (born 1955, Mandeville, Jamaica) is a Jamaican statistician conducting research on matrix analysis, Markov chains, and hyper- geometric domains. He currently serves as a professor of statistics at Pennsylvania State University, and is a Fellow of the American Mathematical Society and the Institute of Mathematical Statistics. Richards obtained his PhD in 1978 at the University of the West Indies, where the statistician Rameshwar D. Gupta was his doctoral advisor. In 2012, he was elected as a Fellow of the American Mathematical Society.List of Fellows of the American Mathematical Society.
